     551             : 
     552             : /*
     553             :  * Describes a single step request.
     554             :  */
     555             : typedef struct {
     556             :         EventRequest *req;
     557             :         MonoInternalThread *thread;
     558             :         StepDepth depth;
     559             :         StepSize size;
     560             :         StepFilter filter;
     561             :         gpointer last_sp;
     562             :         gpointer start_sp;

    1054             : 
    1055             : /*
    1056             :  * finish_agent_init:
    1057             :  *
    1058             :  *   Finish the initialization of the agent. This involves connecting the transport
    1059             :  * and starting the agent thread. This is either done at startup, or
    1060             :  * in response to some event like an unhandled exception.
    1061             :  */
    1062             : static void

    1121             : static int
    1122             : socket_transport_recv (void *buf, int len)
    1123             : {
    1124             :         int res;
    1125           0 :         int total = 0;
    1126           0 :         int fd = conn_fd;
    1127           0 :         int flags = 0;
    1128             :         static gint64 last_keepalive;
    1129             :         gint64 msecs;
    1130             : 
    1131           0 :         MONO_ENTER_GC_SAFE;
    1132             : 
    1133           0 :         do {
    1134             :         again:
    1135           0 :                 res = recv (fd, (char *) buf + total, len - total, flags);
    1136           0 :                 if (res > 0)
    1137           0 :                         total += res;
    1138           0 :                 if (agent_config.keepalive) {
    1139           0 :                         gboolean need_keepalive = FALSE;
    1140           0 :                         if (res == -1 && get_last_sock_error () == MONO_EWOULDBLOCK) {
    1141           0 :                                 need_keepalive = TRUE;
    1142           0 :                         } else if (res == -1) {
    1143             :                                 /* This could happen if recv () is interrupted repeatedly */
    1144           0 :                                 msecs = mono_msec_ticks ();
    1145           0 :                                 if (msecs - last_keepalive >= agent_config.keepalive) {
    1146           0 :                                         need_keepalive = TRUE;
    1147           0 :                                         last_keepalive = msecs;
    1148           0 :                                 }
    1149           0 :                         }
    1150           0 :                         if (need_keepalive) {
    1151           0 :                                 process_profiler_event (EVENT_KIND_KEEPALIVE, NULL);
    1152           0 :                                 goto again;
    1153             :                         }
    1154           0 :                 }
    1155           0 :         } while ((res > 0 && total < len) || (res == -1 && get_last_sock_error () == MONO_EINTR));
    1156             : 
    1157           0 :         MONO_EXIT_GC_SAFE;
    1158             : 
    1159           0 :         return total;
    1160             : }
    1161             :  
    1162             : static void

    1165             :         struct timeval tv;

    1213             : /*
    1214             :  * socket_transport_connect:
    1215             :  *
    1216             :  *   Connect/Listen on HOST:PORT. If HOST is NULL, generate an address and listen on it.

    1379             : static void
    1380             : socket_transport_close1 (void)
    1381             : {
    1382             :         /* This will interrupt the agent thread */
    1383             :         /* Close the read part only so it can still send back replies */
    1384             :         /* Also shut down the connection listener so that we can exit normally */
    1385             : #ifdef HOST_WIN32
    1386             :         /* SD_RECEIVE doesn't break the recv in the debugger thread */
    1387             :         shutdown (conn_fd, SD_BOTH);
    1388             :         shutdown (listen_fd, SD_BOTH);
    1389             :         closesocket (listen_fd);
    1390             : #else
    1391           0 :         shutdown (conn_fd, SHUT_RD);
    1392           0 :         shutdown (listen_fd, SHUT_RDWR);
    1393           0 :         MONO_ENTER_GC_SAFE;
    1394           0 :         close (listen_fd);
    1395           0 :         MONO_EXIT_GC_SAFE;
    1396             : #endif
    1397           0 : }

    1550             : static gboolean
    1551             : transport_handshake (void)
    1552             : {
    1553             :         char handshake_msg [128];
    1554             :         guint8 buf [128];
    1555             :         int res;
    1556             :         
    1557           0 :         disconnected = TRUE;
    1558             :         
    1559             :         /* Write handshake message */
    1560           0 :         sprintf (handshake_msg, "DWP-Handshake");
    1561             : 
    1562           0 :         do {
    1563           0 :                 res = transport_send (handshake_msg, strlen (handshake_msg));
    1564           0 :         } while (res == -1 && get_last_sock_error () == MONO_EINTR);
    1565             : 
    1566           0 :         g_assert (res != -1);
    1567             : 
    1568             :         /* Read answer */
    1569           0 :         res = transport_recv (buf, strlen (handshake_msg));
    1570           0 :         if ((res != strlen (handshake_msg)) || (memcmp (buf, handshake_msg, strlen (handshake_msg)) != 0)) {
    1571           0 :                 fprintf (stderr, "debugger-agent: DWP handshake failed.\n");
    1572           0 :                 return FALSE;
    1573             :         }
    1574             : 
    1575             :         /*
    1576             :          * To support older clients, the client sends its protocol version after connecting
    1577             :          * using a command. Until that is received, default to our protocol version.
    1578             :          */
    1579           0 :         major_version = MAJOR_VERSION;
    1580           0 :         minor_version = MINOR_VERSION;
    1581           0 :         protocol_version_set = FALSE;
    1582             : 
    1583             : #ifndef DISABLE_SOCKET_TRANSPORT
    1584             :         // FIXME: Move this somewhere else
    1585             :         /* 
    1586             :          * Set TCP_NODELAY on the socket so the client receives events/command
    1587             :          * results immediately.
    1588             :          */
    1589           0 :         if (conn_fd) {
    1590           0 :                 int flag = 1;
    1591           0 :                 int result = setsockopt (conn_fd,
    1592             :                                  IPPROTO_TCP,
    1593             :                                  TCP_NODELAY,
    1594           0 :                                  (char *) &flag,
    1595             :                                  sizeof(int));
    1596           0 :                 g_assert (result >= 0);
    1597           0 :         }
    1598             : 
    1599           0 :         set_keepalive ();
    1600             : #endif
    1601             :         
    1602           0 :         disconnected = FALSE;
    1603           0 :         return TRUE;
    1604           0 : }
    1605             : 
    1606             : static void
    1607             : stop_debugger_thread (void)
    1608             : {
    1609           0 :         if (!inited)
    1610           0 :                 return;
    1611             : 
    1612           0 :         transport_close1 ();
    1613             : 
    1614             :         /* 
    1615             :          * Wait for the thread to exit.
    1616             :          *
    1617             :          * If we continue with the shutdown without waiting for it, then the client might
    1618             :          * not receive an answer to its last command like a resume.
    1619             :          */
    1620           0 :         if (!is_debugger_thread ()) {
    1621           0 :                 do {

    1903             : /*
    1904             :  * Represents an object accessible by the debugger client.
    1905             :  */
    1906             : typedef struct {
    1907             :         /* Unique id used in the wire protocol to refer to objects */
    1908             :         int id;
    1909             :         /*
    1910             :          * A weakref gc handle pointing to the object. The gc handle is used to 
    1911             :          * detect if the object was garbage collected.
    1912             :          */
    1913             :         guint32 handle;
    1914             : } ObjRef;
    1915             : 
    1916             : /* Maps objid -> ObjRef */
    1917             : /* Protected by the loader lock */
    1918             : static GHashTable *objrefs;
    1919             : /* Protected by the loader lock */
    1920             : static GHashTable *obj_to_objref;
    1921             : /* Protected by the dbg lock */
    1922             : static MonoGHashTable *suspended_objs;
    1923             : 
    1924             : static void
    1925             : free_objref (gpointer value)
    1926             : {
    1927           0 :         ObjRef *o = (ObjRef *)value;
    1928             : 
    1929           0 :         mono_gchandle_free (o->handle);
    1930             : 
    1931           0 :         g_free (o);
    1932           0 : }

    1941           0 : }

    1949             : 
    1950             : /*
    1951             :  * Return an ObjRef for OBJ.
    1952             :  */
    1953             : static ObjRef*
    1954             : get_objref (MonoObject *obj)
    1955             : {
    1956             :         ObjRef *ref;
    1957           0 :         GSList *reflist = NULL, *l;
    1958           0 :         int hash = 0;
    1959             : 
    1960           0 :         if (obj == NULL)
    1961           0 :                 return NULL;
    1962             : 
    1963           0 :         if (suspend_count) {
    1964             :                 /*
    1965             :                  * Have to keep object refs created during suspensions alive for the duration of the suspension, so GCs during invokes don't collect them.
    1966             :                  */
    1967           0 :                 dbg_lock ();
    1968           0 :                 mono_g_hash_table_insert (suspended_objs, obj, NULL);
    1969           0 :                 dbg_unlock ();
    1970           0 :         }
    1971             : 
    1972           0 :         mono_loader_lock ();
    1973             :         
    1974             :         /* FIXME: The tables can grow indefinitely */
    1975             : 
    1976           0 :         if (mono_gc_is_moving ()) {
    1977             :                 /*
    1978             :                  * Objects can move, so use a hash table mapping hash codes to lists of
    1979             :                  * ObjRef structures.
    1980             :                  */
    1981           0 :                 hash = mono_object_hash (obj);
    1982             : 
    1983           0 :                 reflist = (GSList *)g_hash_table_lookup (obj_to_objref, GINT_TO_POINTER (hash));
    1984           0 :                 for (l = reflist; l; l = l->next) {
    1985           0 :                         ref = (ObjRef *)l->data;
    1986           0 :                         if (ref && mono_gchandle_get_target (ref->handle) == obj) {
    1987           0 :                                 mono_loader_unlock ();
    1988           0 :                                 return ref;
    1989             :                         }
    1990           0 :                 }
    1991           0 :         } else {
    1992             :                 /* Use a hash table with masked pointers to internalize object references */
    1993           0 :                 ref = (ObjRef *)g_hash_table_lookup (obj_to_objref, GINT_TO_POINTER (~((gsize)obj)));
    1994             :                 /* ref might refer to a different object with the same addr which was GCd */
    1995           0 :                 if (ref && mono_gchandle_get_target (ref->handle) == obj) {
    1996           0 :                         mono_loader_unlock ();
    1997           0 :                         return ref;
    1998             :                 }
    1999             :         }
    2000             : 
    2001           0 :         ref = g_new0 (ObjRef, 1);
    2002           0 :         ref->id = InterlockedIncrement (&objref_id);
    2003           0 :         ref->handle = mono_gchandle_new_weakref (obj, FALSE);
    2004             : 
    2005           0 :         g_hash_table_insert (objrefs, GINT_TO_POINTER (ref->id), ref);
    2006             : 
    2007           0 :         if (mono_gc_is_moving ()) {
    2008           0 :                 reflist = g_slist_append (reflist, ref);
    2009           0 :                 g_hash_table_insert (obj_to_objref, GINT_TO_POINTER (hash), reflist);
    2010           0 :         } else {
    2011           0 :                 g_hash_table_insert (obj_to_objref, GINT_TO_POINTER (~((gsize)obj)), ref);
    2012             :         }
    2013             : 
    2014           0 :         mono_loader_unlock ();
    2015             : 
    2016           0 :         return ref;
    2017           0 : }
    2018             : 
    2019             : static gboolean
    2020             : true_pred (gpointer key, gpointer value, gpointer user_data)
    2021             : {
    2022           0 :         return TRUE;
    2023             : }

    2036           0 :         if (!obj)
    2037           0 :                 return 0;

    2041             : 
    2042             : /*

    2044             :  * Returns 0 or an error code if OBJID is invalid or the object has been garbage
    2045             :  * collected.
    2046             :  */
    2047             : static ErrorCode
    2048             : get_object_allow_null (int objid, MonoObject **obj)
    2049             : {
    2050             :         ObjRef *ref;
    2051             : 
    2052           0 :         if (objid == 0) {
    2053           0 :                 *obj = NULL;
    2054           0 :                 return ERR_NONE;
    2055             :         }
    2056             : 
    2057           0 :         if (!objrefs)
    2058           0 :                 return ERR_INVALID_OBJECT;
    2059             : 
    2060           0 :         mono_loader_lock ();
    2061             : 
    2062           0 :         ref = (ObjRef *)g_hash_table_lookup (objrefs, GINT_TO_POINTER (objid));
    2063             : 
    2064           0 :         if (ref) {
    2065           0 :                 *obj = mono_gchandle_get_target (ref->handle);
    2066           0 :                 mono_loader_unlock ();
    2067           0 :                 if (!(*obj))
    2068           0 :                         return ERR_INVALID_OBJECT;
    2069           0 :                 return ERR_NONE;
    2070             :         } else {
    2071           0 :                 mono_loader_unlock ();
    2072           0 :                 return ERR_INVALID_OBJECT;
    2073             :         }
    2074           0 : }

    2116             :  * Represents a runtime structure accessible to the debugger client

    2119             :         /* Unique id used in the wire protocol */
    2120             :         int id;

    2171           0 :                                 g_free (g_ptr_array_index (ids [i], j));

    2174           0 :                 ids [i] = NULL;

    2576           0 :         } else {
    2577             :                 /* 
    2578             :                  * Running native code, will be suspended when it returns to/enters

    2580             :                  * This might interrupt the code in process_single_step_inner (), we use the

    2598             :                          * traces for this thread, but we can't use the current ctx+lmf, since
    2599             :                          * the thread is still running, so it might return to managed code,
    2600             :                          * making these invalid.
    2601             :                          * So we start a stack walk and save the first frame, along with the
    2602             :                          * parent frame's ctx+lmf. This (hopefully) works because the thread will be 
    2603             :                          * suspended when it returns to managed code, so the parent's ctx should
    2604             :                          * remain valid.
    2605             :                          */
    2606           0 :                         data.last_frame_set = FALSE;

    2616           0 :                                 tls->async_state.valid = FALSE;
    2617             :                         }
    2618             : 
    2619           0 :                         mono_memory_barrier ();

    2713             :                  * when executing long running code inside the loader lock, i.e. assembly load
    2714             :                  * hooks.
    2715             :                  */
    2716           0 :                 return;
    2717             :         }

    2750             : /*
    2751             :  * suspend_vm:
    2752             :  *
    2753             :  * Increase the suspend count of the VM. While the suspend count is greater 
    2754             :  * than 0, runtime threads are suspended at certain points during execution.
    2755             :  */
    2756             : static void
    2757             : suspend_vm (void)
    2758             : {
    2759           0 :         mono_loader_lock ();
    2760             : 
    2761           0 :         mono_coop_mutex_lock (&suspend_mutex);
    2762             : 
    2763           0 :         suspend_count ++;
    2764             : 
    2765           0 :         DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "[%p] Suspending vm...\n", (gpointer) (gsize) mono_native_thread_id_get ());
    2766             : 
    2767           0 :         if (suspend_count == 1) {
    2768             :                 // FIXME: Is it safe to call this inside the lock ?
    2769           0 :                 start_single_stepping ();
    2770           0 :                 mono_g_hash_table_foreach (thread_to_tls, notify_thread, NULL);
    2771           0 :         }
    2772             : 
    2773           0 :         mono_coop_mutex_unlock (&suspend_mutex);
    2774             : 
    2775           0 :         if (suspend_count == 1)
    2776             :                 /*
    2777             :                  * Suspend creation of new threadpool threads, since they cannot run
    2778             :                  */

    2780             : 
    2781           0 :         mono_loader_unlock ();
    2782           0 : }
    2783             : 
    2784             : /*
    2785             :  * resume_vm:
    2786             :  *
    2787             :  * Decrease the suspend count of the VM. If the count reaches 0, runtime threads
    2788             :  * are resumed.
    2789             :  */
    2790             : static void
    2791             : resume_vm (void)
    2792             : {
    2793           0 :         g_assert (is_debugger_thread ());
    2794             :

    2797           0 :         mono_coop_mutex_lock (&suspend_mutex);
    2798             : 
    2799           0 :         g_assert (suspend_count > 0);
    2800           0 :         suspend_count --;
    2801             : 
    2802           0 :         DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "[%p] Resuming vm, suspend count=%d...\n", (gpointer) (gsize) mono_native_thread_id_get (), suspend_count);
    2803             : 
    2804           0 :         if (suspend_count == 0) {
    2805             :                 // FIXME: Is it safe to call this inside the lock ?

    2902             :                 /*

    2904             :                  * whole runtime can deadlock otherwise.
    2905             :                  */

    3152             : static void

    3162           0 :         if (tls->frames && tls->frames_up_to_date)
    3163           0 :                 return;
    3164             : 
    3165           0 :         DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "Frames for %p(tid=%lx):\n", thread, (glong)thread->tid);
    3166             : 
    3167           0 :         user_data.tls = tls;
    3168           0 :         user_data.frames = NULL;
    3169           0 :         if (tls->terminated) {

    3171           0 :                 return;

    3173             :                 /* Have to use the state saved by the signal handler */

    3369             : /*
    3370             :  * EVENT HANDLING
    3371             :  */
    3372             : 
    3373             : /*
    3374             :  * create_event_list:
    3375             :  *
    3376             :  *   Return a list of event request ids matching EVENT, starting from REQS, which
    3377             :  * can be NULL to include all event requests. Set SUSPEND_POLICY to the suspend
    3378             :  * policy.
    3379             :  * We return request ids, instead of requests, to simplify threading, since 
    3380             :  * requests could be deleted anytime when the loader lock is not held.
    3381             :  * LOCKING: Assumes the loader lock is held.
    3382             :  */
    3383             : static GSList*

    3551             : 
    3552             : /*
    3553             :  * process_event:
    3554             :  *
    3555             :  *   Send an event to the client, suspending the vm if needed.
    3556             :  * LOCKING: Since this can suspend the calling thread, no locks should be held
    3557             :  * by the caller.
    3558             :  * The EVENTS list is freed by this function.
    3559             :  */
    3560             : static void
    3561             : process_event (EventKind event, gpointer arg, gint32 il_offset, MonoContext *ctx, GSList *events, int suspend_policy)
    3562             : {
    3563             :         Buffer buf;
    3564             :         GSList *l;
    3565           0 :         MonoDomain *domain = mono_domain_get ();
    3566           0 :         MonoThread *thread = NULL;
    3567           0 :         MonoObject *keepalive_obj = NULL;
    3568           0 :         gboolean send_success = FALSE;
    3569             :         static int ecount;
    3570             :         int nevents;
    3571             : 
    3572           0 :         if (!inited) {
    3573           0 :                 DEBUG_PRINTF (2, "Debugger agent not initialized yet: dropping %s\n", event_to_string (event));
    3574           0 :                 return;
    3575             :         }
    3576             : 
    3577           0 :         if (!vm_start_event_sent && event != EVENT_KIND_VM_START) {
    3578             :                 // FIXME: We miss those events
    3579           0 :                 DEBUG_PRINTF (2, "VM start event not sent yet: dropping %s\n", event_to_string (event));
    3580           0 :                 return;
    3581             :         }
    3582             : 
    3583           0 :         if (vm_death_event_sent) {
    3584           0 :                 DEBUG_PRINTF (2, "VM death event has been sent: dropping %s\n", event_to_string (event));
    3585           0 :                 return;
    3586             :         }
    3587             : 
    3588           0 :         if (mono_runtime_is_shutting_down () && event != EVENT_KIND_VM_DEATH) {
    3589           0 :                 DEBUG_PRINTF (2, "Mono runtime is shutting down: dropping %s\n", event_to_string (event));
    3590           0 :                 return;
    3591             :         }
    3592             : 
    3593           0 :         if (disconnected) {
    3594           0 :                 DEBUG_PRINTF (2, "Debugger client is not connected: dropping %s\n", event_to_string (event));
    3595           0 :                 return;
    3596             :         }
    3597             : 
    3598           0 :         if (event == EVENT_KIND_KEEPALIVE)
    3599           0 :                 suspend_policy = SUSPEND_POLICY_NONE;
    3600             :         else {
    3601           0 :                 if (events == NULL)
    3602           0 :                         return;
    3603             : 
    3604           0 :                 if (agent_config.defer) {
    3605             :                         /* Make sure the thread id is always set when doing deferred debugging */
    3606           0 :                         if (is_debugger_thread ()) {
    3607             :                                 /* Don't suspend on events from the debugger thread */
    3608           0 :                                 suspend_policy = SUSPEND_POLICY_NONE;
    3609           0 :                                 thread = mono_thread_get_main ();
    3610           0 :                         }
    3611           0 :                         else thread = mono_thread_current ();
    3612           0 :                 } else {
    3613           0 :                         if (is_debugger_thread () && event != EVENT_KIND_VM_DEATH)
    3614             :                                 // FIXME: Send these with a NULL thread, don't suspend the current thread
    3615           0 :                                 return;
    3616             :                 }
    3617             :         }
    3618             : 
    3619           0 :         nevents = g_slist_length (events);
    3620           0 :         buffer_init (&buf, 128);

    3622           0 :         buffer_add_int (&buf, nevents);
    3623             : 
    3624           0 :         for (l = events; l; l = l->next) {

    3626           0 :                 buffer_add_int (&buf, GPOINTER_TO_INT (l->data)); // request id
    3627             : 
    3628           0 :                 ecount ++;
    3629             :

    3631           0 :                         thread = NULL;

    3633           0 :                         if (!thread)
    3634           0 :                                 thread = mono_thread_current ();
    3635             : 
    3636           0 :                         if (event == EVENT_KIND_VM_START && arg != NULL)
    3637           0 :                                 thread = (MonoThread *)arg;
    3638             :                 }
    3639             : 
    3640           0 :                 buffer_add_objid (&buf, (MonoObject*)thread); // thread
    3641             :

    4074             : 
    4075             : /*
    4076             :  * Contains generic information about a breakpoint.
    4077             :  */
    4078             : typedef struct {
    4079             :         /* 
    4080             :          * The method where the breakpoint is placed. Can be NULL in which case it 
    4081             :          * is inserted into every method. This is used to implement method entry/
    4082             :          * exit events. Can be a generic method definition, in which case the
    4083             :          * breakpoint is inserted into every instance.
    4084             :          */

    4086             :         long il_offset;
    4087             :         EventRequest *req;

    4089             :          * A list of BreakpointInstance structures describing where the breakpoint
    4090             :          * was inserted. There could be more than one because of 
    4091             :          * generics/appdomains/method entry/exit.
    4092             :          */
    4093             :         GPtrArray *children;
    4094             : } MonoBreakpoint;
    4095             : 
    4096             : /* List of breakpoints */
    4097             : /* Protected by the loader lock */
    4098             : static GPtrArray *breakpoints;
    4099             : /* Maps breakpoint locations to the number of breakpoints at that location */
    4100             : static GHashTable *bp_locs;
    4101             : 
    4102             : static void

    4104             : {

    4108             : 
    4109             : /*
    4110             :  * insert_breakpoint:

    4113             :  * JI.
    4114             :  */
    4115             : static void
    4116             : insert_breakpoint (MonoSeqPointInfo *seq_points, MonoDomain *domain, MonoJitInfo *ji, MonoBreakpoint *bp, MonoError *error)
    4117             : {
    4118             :         int count;
    4119             :         BreakpointInstance *inst;
    4120             :         SeqPointIterator it;
    4121           0 :         gboolean it_has_sp = FALSE;
    4122             : 
    4123           0 :         if (error)
    4124           0 :                 mono_error_init (error);
    4125             : 
    4126           0 :         mono_seq_point_iterator_init (&it, seq_points);
    4127           0 :         while (mono_seq_point_iterator_next (&it)) {
    4128           0 :                 if (it.seq_point.il_offset == bp->il_offset) {
    4129           0 :                         it_has_sp = TRUE;
    4130           0 :                         break;
    4131             :                 }
    4132             :         }
    4133             : 
    4134           0 :         if (!it_has_sp) {
    4135             :                 /*
    4136             :                  * The set of IL offsets with seq points doesn't completely match the
    4137             :                  * info returned by CMD_METHOD_GET_DEBUG_INFO (#407).
    4138             :                  */
    4139           0 :                 mono_seq_point_iterator_init (&it, seq_points);

    4227             : static inline gboolean
    4228             : bp_matches_method (MonoBreakpoint *bp, MonoMethod *method)
    4229             : {
    4230             :         int i;
    4231             : 
    4232           0 :         if (!bp->method)
    4233           0 :                 return TRUE;

    4235           0 :                 return TRUE;
    4236           0 :         if (method->is_inflated && ((MonoMethodInflated*)method)->declaring == bp->method)
    4237           0 :                 return TRUE;
    4238             : 
    4239           0 :         if (bp->method->is_inflated && method->is_inflated) {
    4240           0 :                 MonoMethodInflated *bpimethod = (MonoMethodInflated*)bp->method;
    4241           0 :                 MonoMethodInflated *imethod = (MonoMethodInflated*)method;
    4242             : 
    4243             :                 /* Open generic methods should match closed generic methods of the same class */

    4273           0 :                 return;

    4276             :

    4343             : static void
    4344             : clear_breakpoint (MonoBreakpoint *bp);
    4345             : 
    4346             : /*
    4347             :  * set_breakpoint:
    4348             :  *
    4349             :  *   Set a breakpoint at IL_OFFSET in METHOD.
    4350             :  * METHOD can be NULL, in which case a breakpoint is placed in all methods.
    4351             :  * METHOD can also be a generic method definition, in which case a breakpoint
    4352             :  * is placed in all instances of the method.
    4353             :  * If ERROR is non-NULL, then it is set and NULL is returnd if some breakpoints couldn't be
    4354             :  * inserted.
    4355             :  */
    4356             : static MonoBreakpoint*
    4357             : set_breakpoint (MonoMethod *method, long il_offset, EventRequest *req, MonoError *error)

    4377             :

    4529             : /*
    4530             :  * ss_update:
    4531             :  *
    4532             :  * Return FALSE if single stepping needs to continue.
    4533             :  */
    4534             : static gboolean
    4535             : ss_update (SingleStepReq *req, MonoJitInfo *ji, SeqPoint *sp, DebuggerTlsData *tls, MonoContext *ctx)
    4536             : {
    4537             :         MonoDebugMethodInfo *minfo;
    4538           0 :         MonoDebugSourceLocation *loc = NULL;
    4539           0 :         gboolean hit = TRUE;
    4540             :         MonoMethod *method;
    4541             : 
    4542           0 :         if (req->depth == STEP_DEPTH_OVER && (sp->flags & MONO_SEQ_POINT_FLAG_NONEMPTY_STACK)) {
    4543             :                 /*
    4544             :                  * These seq points are inserted by the JIT after calls, step over needs to skip them.
    4545             :                  */
    4546           0 :                 DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "[%p] Seq point at nonempty stack %x while stepping over, continuing single stepping.\n", (gpointer) (gsize) mono_native_thread_id_get (), sp->il_offset);
    4547           0 :                 return FALSE;
    4548             :         }
    4549             : 
    4550           0 :         if ((req->depth == STEP_DEPTH_OVER || req->depth == STEP_DEPTH_OUT) && hit) {
    4551           0 :                 gboolean is_step_out = req->depth == STEP_DEPTH_OUT;
    4552             : 
    4553           0 :                 ss_calculate_framecount (tls, ctx);
    4554             : 
    4555             :                 // Because functions can call themselves recursively, we need to make sure we're stopping at the right stack depth.
    4556             :                 // In case of step out, the target is the frame *enclosing* the one where the request was made.
    4557           0 :                 int target_frames = req->nframes + (is_step_out ? -1 : 0);
    4558           0 :                 if (req->nframes > 0 && tls->frame_count > 0 && tls->frame_count > target_frames) {
    4559             :                         /* Hit the breakpoint in a recursive call, don't halt */
    4560           0 :                         DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "[%p] Breakpoint at lower frame while stepping %s, continuing single stepping.\n", (gpointer) (gsize) mono_native_thread_id_get (), is_step_out ? "out" : "over");
    4561           0 :                         return FALSE;
    4562             :                 }
    4563           0 :         }
    4564             : 
    4565           0 :         if (req->depth == STEP_DEPTH_INTO && req->size == STEP_SIZE_MIN && (sp->flags & MONO_SEQ_POINT_FLAG_NONEMPTY_STACK) && ss_req->start_method){

    4567           0 :                 ss_calculate_framecount (tls, ctx);
    4568           0 :                 if (ss_req->start_method == method && req->nframes && tls->frame_count == req->nframes) {//Check also frame count(could be recursion)
    4569           0 :                         DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "[%p] Seq point at nonempty stack %x while stepping in, continuing single stepping.\n", (gpointer) (gsize) mono_native_thread_id_get (), sp->il_offset);
    4570           0 :                         return FALSE;
    4571             :                 }
    4572           0 :         }
    4573             : 
    4574           0 :         if (req->size != STEP_SIZE_LINE)
    4575           0 :                 return TRUE;
    4576             : 
    4577             :         /* Have to check whenever a different source line was reached */
    4578           0 :         method = jinfo_get_method (ji);
    4579           0 :         minfo = mono_debug_lookup_method (method);
    4580             : 
    4581           0 :         if (minfo)
    4582           0 :                 loc = mono_debug_method_lookup_location (minfo, sp->il_offset);
    4583             : 
    4584           0 :         if (!loc) {
    4585           0 :                 DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "[%p] No line number info for il offset %x, continuing single stepping.\n", (gpointer) (gsize) mono_native_thread_id_get (), sp->il_offset);
    4586           0 :                 ss_req->last_method = method;
    4587           0 :                 hit = FALSE;
    4588           0 :         } else if (loc && method == ss_req->last_method && loc->row == ss_req->last_line) {
    4589           0 :                 ss_calculate_framecount (tls, ctx);
    4590           0 :                 if (tls->frame_count == req->nframes) { // If the frame has changed we're clearly not on the same source line.
    4591           0 :                         DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "[%p] Same source line (%d), continuing single stepping.\n", (gpointer) (gsize) mono_native_thread_id_get (), loc->row);
    4592           0 :                         hit = FALSE;
    4593           0 :                 }
    4594           0 :         }
    4595             :

    4599           0 :                 mono_debug_free_source_location (loc);
    4600           0 :         }
    4601             : 
    4602           0 :         return hit;
    4603           0 : }

    4611             : static void
    4612             : process_breakpoint_inner (DebuggerTlsData *tls, gboolean from_signal)
    4613             : {

    5059             : /*
    5060             :  * start_single_stepping:
    5061             :  *
    5062             :  *   Turn on single stepping. Can be called multiple times, for example,
    5063             :  * by a single step event request + a suspend.

    5065             : static void
    5066             : start_single_stepping (void)
    5067             : {

    5069           0 :         int val = InterlockedIncrement (&ss_count);

    5071           0 :         if (val == 1)
    5072           0 :                 mono_arch_start_single_stepping ();

    5075             : #endif
    5076           0 : }
    5077             : 
    5078             : static void
    5079             : stop_single_stepping (void)
    5080             : {
    5081             : #ifdef MONO_ARCH_SOFT_DEBUG_SUPPORTED
    5082           0 :         int val = InterlockedDecrement (&ss_count);
    5083             : 
    5084           0 :         if (val == 0)

    5156           0 :         const MonoBreakpoint *s = (const MonoBreakpoint *)data;

    5159           0 :         hash ^= ((guint)s->il_offset) >> 16;

    5161             : }

    5165             : /*
    5166             :  * ss_bp_add_one:

    5533             : 
    5534             : static void
    5535             : ss_clear_for_assembly (SingleStepReq *req, MonoAssembly *assembly)
    5536             : {
    5537             :         GSList *l;
    5538           0 :         gboolean found = TRUE;
    5539             : 
    5540           0 :         while (found) {
    5541           0 :                 found = FALSE;
    5542           0 :                 for (l = ss_req->bps; l; l = l->next) {
    5543           0 :                         if (breakpoint_matches_assembly ((MonoBreakpoint *)l->data, assembly)) {
    5544           0 :                                 clear_breakpoint ((MonoBreakpoint *)l->data);
    5545           0 :                                 ss_req->bps = g_slist_delete_link (ss_req->bps, l);
    5546           0 :                                 found = TRUE;
    5547           0 :                                 break;
    5548             :                         }

    5737             : 
    5738             : void
    5739             : mono_debugger_agent_begin_exception_filter (MonoException *exc, MonoContext *ctx, MonoContext *orig_ctx)
    5740             : {
    5741             :         DebuggerTlsData *tls;
    5742             : 
    5743         200 :         if (!inited)
    5744         200 :                 return;
    5745             : 
    5746           0 :         tls = (DebuggerTlsData *)mono_native_tls_get_value (debugger_tls_id);
    5747           0 :         if (!tls)
    5748           0 :                 return;
    5749             : 
    5750             :         /*
    5751             :          * We're about to invoke an exception filter during the first pass of exception handling.
    5752             :          *
    5753             :          * 'ctx' is the context that'll get passed to the filter ('call_filter (ctx, ei->data.filter)'),
    5754             :          * 'orig_ctx' is the context where the exception has been thrown.
    5755             :          *
    5756             :          *
    5757             :          * See mcs/class/Mono.Debugger.Soft/Tests/dtest-excfilter.il for an example.
    5758             :          *
    5759             :          * If we're stopped in Filter(), normal stack unwinding would first unwind to
    5760             :          * the call site (line 37) and then continue to Main(), but it would never
    5761             :          * include the throw site (line 32).
    5762             :          *
    5763             :          * Since exception filters are invoked during the first pass of exception handling,
    5764             :          * the stack frames of the throw site are still intact, so we should include them
    5765             :          * in a stack trace.
    5766             :          *
    5767             :          * We do this here by saving the context of the throw site in 'tls->filter_state'.
    5768             :          *
    5769             :          * Exception filters are used by MonoDroid, where we want to stop inside a call filter,
    5770             :          * but report the location of the 'throw' to the user.
    5771             :          *
    5772             :          */
    5773             : 
    5774           0 :         g_assert (mono_thread_state_init_from_monoctx (&tls->filter_state, orig_ctx));
    5775         200 : }
    5776             : 
    5777             : void
    5778             : mono_debugger_agent_end_exception_filter (MonoException *exc, MonoContext *ctx, MonoContext *orig_ctx)
    5779             : {
    5780             :         DebuggerTlsData *tls;
    5781             : 
    5782         200 :         if (!inited)
    5783         200 :                 return;
    5784             : 
    5785           0 :         tls = (DebuggerTlsData *)mono_native_tls_get_value (debugger_tls_id);
    5786           0 :         if (!tls)
    5787           0 :                 return;
    5788             : 
    5789           0 :         tls->filter_state.valid = FALSE;
    5790         200 : }
    5791             : 
    5792             : /*
    5793             :  * buffer_add_value_full:

    6006             : static ErrorCode
    6007             : decode_vtype (MonoType *t, MonoDomain *domain, guint8 *addr, guint8 *buf, guint8 **endbuf, guint8 *limit)

    6009             :         gboolean is_enum;

    6013           0 :         gpointer iter = NULL;
    6014             :         MonoDomain *d;
    6015             :         ErrorCode err;
    6016             : 
    6017           0 :         is_enum = decode_byte (buf, &buf, limit);
    6018             :         /* Enums are sent as a normal vtype */
    6019           0 :         if (is_enum)
    6020           0 :                 return ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED;

    6463             : static void
    6464             : clear_event_request (int req_id, int etype)
    6465             : {
    6466             :         int i;
    6467             : 
    6468           0 :         mono_loader_lock ();
    6469           0 :         for (i = 0; i < event_requests->len; ++i) {
    6470           0 :                 EventRequest *req = (EventRequest *)g_ptr_array_index (event_requests, i);
    6471             :

    6473           0 :                         if (req->event_kind == EVENT_KIND_BREAKPOINT)
    6474           0 :                                 clear_breakpoint ((MonoBreakpoint *)req->info);

    6861             :  * invoke_method:

    6865             : static void
    6866             : invoke_method (void)
    6867             : {
    6868             :         DebuggerTlsData *tls;
    6869             :         InvokeData *invoke;

    6878           0 :         g_assert (tls);
    6879             : 
    6880             :         /*
    6881             :          * Store the `InvokeData *' in `tls->invoke' until we're done with

    6883             :          */
    6884             : 
    6885           0 :         mono_loader_lock ();
    6886             : 
    6887           0 :         invoke = tls->pending_invoke;
    6888           0 :         g_assert (invoke);

    6890             :

    6892           0 :         tls->invoke = invoke;
    6893             : 
    6894           0 :         mono_loader_unlock ();

    6897             : 
    6898           0 :         id = invoke->id;
    6899             :

    6904             : 
    6905           0 :                 if (err) {
    6906             :                         /* Fail the other invokes as well */
    6907           0 :                 } else {
    6908           0 :                         err = do_invoke_method (tls, &buf, invoke, p, &p);
    6909             :                 }
    6910             :

    6913           0 :                                 err = ERR_INVOKE_ABORTED;
    6914           0 :                 }
    6915             :

    9132             : static ErrorCode
    9133             : frame_commands (int command, guint8 *p, guint8 *end, Buffer *buf)
    9134             : {
    9135             :         int objid;
    9136             :         ErrorCode err;

    9143             :         MonoMethodSignature *sig;
    9144             :         gssize id;
    9145             :         MonoMethodHeader *header;
    9146             : 
    9147           0 :         objid = decode_objid (p, &p, end);
    9148           0 :         err = get_object (objid, (MonoObject**)&thread_obj);

    9151             :

    9155             : 
    9156           0 :         mono_loader_lock ();
    9157           0 :         tls = (DebuggerTlsData *)mono_g_hash_table_lookup (thread_to_tls, thread);
    9158           0 :         mono_loader_unlock ();
    9159           0 :         g_assert (tls);
    9160             : 
    9161           0 :         for (i = 0; i < tls->frame_count; ++i) {
    9162           0 :                 if (tls->frames [i]->id == id)
    9163           0 :                         break;
    9164           0 :         }
    9165           0 :         if (i == tls->frame_count)
    9166           0 :                 return ERR_INVALID_FRAMEID;
    9167             : 
    9168           0 :         frame_idx = i;
    9169           0 :         frame = tls->frames [frame_idx];
    9170             : 
    9171             :         /* This is supported for frames without has_ctx etc. set */
    9172           0 :         if (command == CMD_STACK_FRAME_GET_DOMAIN) {
    9173           0 :                 if (CHECK_PROTOCOL_VERSION (2, 38))
    9174           0 :                         buffer_add_domainid (buf, frame->domain);
    9175           0 :                 return ERR_NONE;
    9176             :         }
    9177             : 
    9178           0 :         if (!frame->has_ctx)
    9179           0 :                 return ERR_ABSENT_INFORMATION;
    9180             : 
    9181           0 :         if (!frame->jit) {
    9182           0 :                 frame->jit = mono_debug_find_method (frame->api_method, frame->domain);
    9183           0 :                 if (!frame->jit && frame->api_method->is_inflated)
    9184           0 :                         frame->jit = mono_debug_find_method (mono_method_get_declaring_generic_method (frame->api_method), frame->domain);

    9186             :                         char *s;
    9187             : 
    9188             :                         /* This could happen for aot images with no jit debug info */
    9189           0 :                         s = mono_method_full_name (frame->api_method, TRUE);
    9190           0 :                         DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "[dbg] No debug information found for '%s'.\n", s);
    9191           0 :                         g_free (s);
    9192           0 :                         return ERR_ABSENT_INFORMATION;
    9193             :                 }
    9194           0 :         }
    9195           0 :         jit = frame->jit;
    9196             : 
    9197           0 :         sig = mono_method_signature (frame->actual_method);
    9198             : 
    9199           0 :         if (!jit->has_var_info || !mono_get_seq_points (frame->domain, frame->actual_method))
    9200             :                 /*
    9201             :                  * The method is probably from an aot image compiled without soft-debug, variables might be dead, etc.
    9202             :                  */
    9203           0 :                 return ERR_ABSENT_INFORMATION;
    9204             : 
    9205           0 :         switch (command) {
    9206             :         case CMD_STACK_FRAME_GET_VALUES: {
    9207             :                 MonoError error;
    9208           0 :                 len = decode_int (p, &p, end);
    9209           0 :                 header = mono_method_get_header_checked (frame->actual_method, &error);
    9210           0 :                 mono_error_assert_ok (&error); /* FIXME report error */
    9211             : 
    9212           0 :                 for (i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
    9213           0 :                         pos = decode_int (p, &p, end);
    9214             : 
    9215           0 :                         if (pos < 0) {
    9216           0 :                                 pos = - pos - 1;
    9217             : 
    9218           0 :                                 DEBUG_PRINTF (4, "[dbg]   send arg %d.\n", pos);
    9219             : 
    9220           0 :                                 g_assert (pos >= 0 && pos < jit->num_params);
    9221             : 
    9222           0 :                                 add_var (buf, jit, sig->params [pos], &jit->params [pos], &frame->ctx, frame->domain, FALSE);
    9223           0 :                         } else {
    9224             :                                 MonoDebugLocalsInfo *locals;
    9225             : 
    9226           0 :                                 locals = mono_debug_lookup_locals (frame->method);
    9227           0 :                                 if (locals) {
    9228           0 :                                         g_assert (pos < locals->num_locals);
    9229           0 :                                         pos = locals->locals [pos].index;
    9230           0 :                                         mono_debug_free_locals (locals);
    9231           0 :                                 }

    9848             : static gboolean
    9849             : wait_for_attach (void)

    9851             : #ifndef DISABLE_SOCKET_TRANSPORT
    9852           0 :         if (listen_fd == -1) {
    9853           0 :                 DEBUG_PRINTF (1, "[dbg] Invalid listening socket\n");
    9854           0 :                 return FALSE;
    9855             :         }
    9856             : 
    9857             :         /* Block and wait for client connection */

    9874             :         }
    9875             :         
    9876           0 :         return TRUE;
    9877           0 : }

    9879             : /*
    9880             :  * debugger_thread:
    9881             :  *
    9882             :  *   This thread handles communication with the debugger client using a JDWP
    9883             :  * like protocol.
    9884             :  */

    9888             :         MonoError error;
    9889           0 :         int res, len, id, flags, command = 0;
